links.title: Apple removing Facebook's Onavo for gathering data about apps on your phone
links.description: If you were on the edge of your seat wondering what Facebook's next major consumer privacy headache would be, the wait is over! The Wall Street Journal reports that Apple has deemed Facebook-owned app Onavo in violation of its App Store policies and will be giving it the boot shortly.

Apple to Release Low-Cost, Hi-Res Retina MacBook This Year: Report.

$AAPL $HPQ 

https://www.investopedia.com/news/apple-release-lowcost-hires-retina-macbook-year-report/

links.title: Apple to Release Low-Cost, Hi-Res Retina MacBook This Year: Report
links.description: Apple Inc. ( AAPL) is set to launch two new Mac computers later this year, people familiar with the matter have told Bloomberg. The Cupertino, California-based company plans to release a cheaper MacBook Air and an updated Mac mini, bringing an end to a drought in computer-related product launches that has frustrated some of the iPhone maker's client base and weighed on sales of Apple's longest-running line of devices.

messages.body:
Netflix Wants to Avoid Apple App Store Fees 

$NFLX $AAPL $SPOT 

https://www.investopedia.com/news/netflix-wants-avoid-apple-app-store-fees/

links.title: Netflix Wants to Avoid Apple App Store Fees
links.description: Netflix Inc. ( NFLX) is testing a new payment feature designed to stop Apple Inc. ( AAPL) from taking a cut of its revenue streams. The streaming video giant is preventing new and existing customers in Europe, Latin America and Asia from paying for subscriptions through iTunes, redirecting them instead to sign up to its service via a mobile version of Netflix's own website, according to TechCrunch.

messages.body: $P Premium listeners can now share music on $SNAP &  can share their favorites via $AAPL iMessage, $FB, & more.

$AAPL Apple CEO Is Set to Receive 280K Shares: Report

https://www.investopedia.com/news/apple-ceo-set-receive-280k-shares-report/

links.title: Apple CEO Is Set to Receive 280K Shares: Report
links.description: Apple Inc. ( AAPL) Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook is poised to receive stock in the company he leads that is valued at well over $100 million. Thanks to a run-up in the iPhone maker's stock, Cook, who receives 280,000 shares at the end of the week tied to his compensation, could be sitting on a windfall of $120 million, reported Bloomberg News.
